::: {#28a80cbb .cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Data
wins = 55
losses = 44
ot_losses = 10
total_games = wins + losses + ot_losses

# Labels and sizes for the pie chart
labels = ['Wins', 'Losses', 'Overtime Losses']
sizes = [wins, losses, ot_losses]
colors = ['#4CAF50', '#F44336', '#FF9800']  # Green, Red, Orange for the slices

# Plot the pie chart
fig, ax = plt.subplots()
ax.pie(sizes, labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%', colors=colors, startangle=90, wedgeprops={'edgecolor': 'black'})

# Title of the pie chart
ax.set_title('Win-Loss Record Distribution')

# Equal aspect ratio ensures that pie chart is drawn as a circle.
ax.axis('equal')

# Show the plot
plt.show()
```
